Anyone interested in the legalities around calling yourself an engineer should check out the responses.👇🏼 https://t.co/5eCZLtb1tv
@peter_nitsch @derekkinsman 🤔 I guess it's not strictly enforced? Cause I'm sure not all people calling themselves that have a licence.
@derekkinsman Wanna get in on this engineering convo?☝🏼 Didn't you post something about the legalities of its usage a little while back?
@noahsussman @chris_mcmahon I *think* there might be something similar here but not really strictly enforced? (Don't quote me on that!)
@noahsussman No worries. My husband is American so I guess that makes me US-adjacent ;)
@noahsussman It kind of makes me think of cheesy stock photography of random code on a screen used in "tech" articles. 🙃
@noahsussman Engineer is not used as commonly in Canada (though that is changing) so that feels weird to me too.
I don't know why but I don't like to be referred to as a "coder." I prefer web developer or even programmer.
My to-do list usually entails me ticking off one thing and adding two things. I feel like I'm hustling backwards.
@subfuzion Rather than gaining confidence through actually being able to work at & eventually be able to do the thing you were trying to do.
@subfuzion It IS lame. I feel like it's rooted in this "fake it 'til you make it" mentality. Give the appearance of doing something...
@subfuzion I've just realized that people do that follow/unfollow crap to gain followers. SO WEIRD.
@andreaop_ux Something like seeing what's going on in the world?
Feeling very distracted today. 😑
